name: Homewood Suites by Hilton Chicago Downtown

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed here for a week in August/Sept 09.
reviews.title: Good location, OK rooms

reviews.text: The good points: The location is excellent, close to the Magnificent Mile, the Grand Ave El, lots of restaurants and shops. The rooms are fairly spacious and we got an excellent room rate. The staff were friendly and helpful. The kitchen is fully equipped with a full sized fridge with ice maker.
reviews.title: Fantastic Hotel - Great Staff, Location - All the comforts of home.

reviews.text: The bad points: The breakfast room had an awful smell about it. The food at breakfast was very average, and they ran out of some things every morning. There was always a massive queue to get a table at breakfast, and there were endless screaming kids about. The room was very dated, and needed to be revamped. The bathroom was small and a bit grubby, and the shower didn't have a lot of pressure. The sheets didn't fit the bed properly and every night they came off the sides of the bed so we ended up partially sleeping directly on the mattress. The bedding also felt very cheap, with what felt like nylon sheets. The lift was slow. The windows in our room were so dirty, you couldn't see out for the smears all over them.
reviews.title: Homewood made son's Wedding weekend smooth and stress free

reviews.text: If you are looing for a cheap place to stay in the middle of things, this is the place. If you are looking for a sophisticated hotel, this is not the place to stay. There are plenty of other nicers places to stay.
reviews.title: Great, except when you leave!
Wonderful city to explore!
reviews.text: We recently stayed here on a family trip to Chicago. My husband and I were traveling with our 10 month-old son and 3 year-old son. From the moment of our arrival our experience was completely positive. The valets were very helpful with unloading the kids and luggage from the car. The staff at the front desk was fantastic. They had a crib delivered to our room within 20 minutes of our arrival. The complimentary dinner the first night was great. After traveling all afternoon, it was nice that we didn't have to try and make arrangments for dinner. The staff in "the lodge" where dinner and breakfast were served was very friendly and attentive, as well. It was nice that they had carry-out containers available to take dinner and breakfast back to the room if you don't want to eat in the dining room. Throughout our stay, all of the staff were friendly and helpful. The room was great. It was like having an apartment, and gave us plenty of room for the kids to spread out with their toys and play. It was nice to have the kitchen, especially for preparing bottles, and for having dinner in the room which was generally carry-out from area restaurants. The hotel has a room service arrangement with P.F. Chang's, and is within walking distance of a lot of nice restaurants. Great location for walking to area attractions - the Magnificent Mile, Navy Pier. We are already planning to retun next summer, and will recommend the Homewood Suites to our family and friends.

Perfect location, clean and courteous staff all added up to a great stay. Its in an area with plenty of stores ( The Mile) and restaurants. Hotel lobby is on the 6th floor and the elevator to get there was annoyingly slow but overall I would highly recommend this place regardless if your there with a family, friends or on business. The subway to Wrigley is a 1/2 block away from the front door.
reviews.title: Highly Recommend !!

reviews.text: We stayed here for the fourth time from July 26 to Aug.3 and had a wonderful time (as ususual!). We did encounter a few problems but they were dealt with quickly and joyfully. This suite hotel is fab, but it's the people that work there that make this the BEST hotel in Chicago. Kudos to these wonderful people...John, the assist. General Manager, who took a personal interest in our stay,and the problems we encountered. John, went beyond the call of duty. When my room key wouldn't work for the 3rd time, he PERSONALLY escorted me to my room...NOW THAT'S SERVICE! Thanks for all that you did John, I will always remember your kindness and understanding:D
reviews.title: 5 Star service at this Great Homewood Suites Downtown!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Jonah, one of the best bell men ever always had a smile and kind word, he really did make me feel like I was coming "home" after a long day of shoppping/sightseeing. We shared more than a few restaurant reviews...thanks!
reviews.title: Perfect location

reviews.text: The wonderful ladies who manned the front desk...always friendly and helpful! No request was ever too big to be accomodated.
reviews.title: Great place to stay, convenient to many attractions

reviews.text: Connie that worked in the lodge...a smile every morning! along with that free breakfast!. I had gotten a touch of food poisoning one night and told Connie about the experience...she offered to get me some ginger ale to settle my stomache! Connie was working here that last time we were at the Suites in '07...and she remembered us!
reviews.title: Great location, average rooms, poor staff & service.

reviews.text: Stayed for 5 nights on the 19th floor great view and spacious room with kitchen facilities.
reviews.title: Great stay loved this hotel

reviews.text: Free breakfast every day and dinner Monday to Thursday the great thing was they provided take away boxes so you could take the food back to your room. Location is very good. Staff are very polite and very helpful would definately stay again
reviews.title: highly recommended

reviews.text: we stayed here in january when it was -20. but even then we enjoyed it so much we could not wait to get back. chicago is a great town to visit and the homewood suites is the place to stay, period.
reviews.title: Chicago with a 13 month old

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: now we stayed from the 9/5/2009 to 9/5/2009 and enjoyed every day. (p.s. the weather was in the high 70s). to get back to the hotel, it was fantastic, it has everything you need and its write in the heart of the city.
reviews.title: Professional, friendly, attentive staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: two seperate rooms were very handy as we had our teenage son. full kitchen, (laundry on 7th floor) seveal foodmarkets within walking distance, everything within walking distance. you wont need a car and at $42 for valet parking you wont want one. dont take my word for it , check it out you wont be disappointed. oh and did i mention free breakfast and dinner . job done. its a no brainer
reviews.title: Fabulous hotel!

reviews.text: The lobby of the Homewood is right down the hall from the kitchen and dining room(actually more of a grade school cafeteria type set up). The odors from the kitchen were disgusting, and indeed reminded my of that of a institutional kitchen(I.e. hospital). The free breakfast and free dinner were not at all palatable. I suppose that if you are traveling with a young family as many guests were, that makes this hotel a good value. But i would not stay here again.
reviews.title: food odors!!
Great Hotel. Would Stay Again!
reviews.text: Homewood Suites, Downtown, was great. Toni, checked us in, and she was great. She gave us a room on the 17th floor because my son want to see the skyline at night. They serve breakfast everyday, and it was delicious. Plus, its Free. The staff in the dining room were exceptionally pleasant and helpful. We never ate dinner at the hotel, but one night my husband brought me carrot cake and it was great. The hotel is within walking distance to Grant Park. We would definitely stay here again, and I hope we can go back soon.

Forty members of our family attended a four day/night 90th birthday week and party for our Mother (Grandmother, Great Grandmother, Sister, Aunt, etc.) and it couldn't have been better. All staff were more than helpful and courteous and friendly. In addition to full kitchens, a full hot breakfast and dinner each day we were able to keep expenses down for everyone. Our hotel contact, Alec Schraegle, worked with us over a year's planning and not only met but exceeded our expectations. Our family has stayed at this hotel for several years and have always been delighted with our choice. Highly Recommended.
reviews.title: Terrific Service & Amenities for our Mom's 90th Birthday Week for 40

reviews.text: Pretty much ditto with everything everyone else has said. I will add one comment that I think family's with small children need to be aware of.
reviews.title: Good place to stay

reviews.text: I was sitting on the floor with my 2yr old watching the scenery from our room and noticed that there are handles about 2 1/2 ft above the floor. I turned the handles and the window opened up from the top inward. My wife kinda freaked thinking how dangerous it was. There was actually a sign above it to warn guests. Of course my little girl wanted to open it again, and I told her not to and didn't have any more issues. We were on the 17th floor.
reviews.title: great value for the location

aka: Homewood Suites By Hilton Chicago Downtown Hotel Chicago

Our location places you within walking distance to the Magnificent Mile, world-class restaurants and the infamous Chicago attractions. Where service is nothing short of extraordinary, the Homewood Suites family will welcome your every request. All of our guests will enjoy the following amenities,•Spacious, Newly Renovated two-room King suite with separate living, sleeping areas and fully equipped kitchens •Complimentary daily hot breakfast buffet •Complimentary Monday through Thursday Dinner Reception, meal with beer, wine and soda •Complimentary high-speed Wireless Internet access throughout the Hotel •Complimentary executive business center with high-speed Internet access •Complimentary cardio-fitness and indoor pool •Complimentary grocery shopping service •Complimentary coffee, tea, hot chocolate or cider all day long in the lobby •24 hour convenience shop •Hilton Honors Points –receive BOTH airline miles and hotel points for every stay with us.
